remarks: Rearrange a sum via an arbitrary bijection on ` ( M ... N ) ` . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 27-Feb-2014.)  (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 24-Apr-2016.)
statement:
seqf1o.1 $e |- ( ( ph /\ ( x e. S /\ y e. S ) ) -> ( x .+ y ) e. S ) $.
seqf1o.2 $e |- ( ( ph /\ ( x e. C /\ y e. C ) ) -> ( x .+ y ) = ( y .+ x ) ) $.
seqf1o.3 $e |- ( ( ph /\ ( x e. S /\ y e. S /\ z e. S ) ) -> ( ( x .+ y ) .+ z ) = ( x .+ ( y .+ z ) ) ) $.
seqf1o.4 $e |- ( ph -> N e. ( ZZ>= ` M ) ) $.
seqf1o.5 $e |- ( ph -> C C_ S ) $.
seqf1o.6 $e |- ( ph -> F : ( M ... N ) -1-1-onto-> ( M ... N ) ) $.
seqf1o.7 $e |- ( ( ph /\ x e. ( M ... N ) ) -> ( G ` x ) e. C ) $.
seqf1o.8 $e |- ( ( ph /\ k e. ( M ... N ) ) -> ( H ` k ) = ( G ` ( F ` k ) ) ) $.
seqf1o $p |- ( ph -> ( seq M ( .+ , H ) ` N ) = ( seq M ( .+ , G ) ` N ) ) $.
$d .+ k x y z $.
$d C k x y z $.
$d F k x y z $.
$d G k x y z $.
$d H k $.
$d M k x y z $.
$d N k x y z $.
$d S k x y z $.
$d k ph x y z $.
$d k x y z $.
$d x y z $.
